premium.exchangeTip1: Internet/mobile exchanges offer 50-80% better rates than bank counters
premium.exchangeTip2: Major currencies (USD, EUR, JPY) are more favorable at local banks than airports
premium.exchangeTip3: When paying by card, choose local currency (decline DCC) for better rates
premium.exchangeTip4: For large amounts, use exchange rate coupons for better deals
premium.exchangeTimingText: Exchange rates tend to be stable at the beginning of months and weeks. If there are no drastic fluctuations, split exchanges 2-3 weeks before your trip are recommended.
premium.customsTip1: Currently within duty-free range. Verify when making additional purchases.
premium.customsTip1Alternative: If possible, split orders to stay under $150 per order to avoid duties.
premium.customsTip2: Products from FTA countries may have different customs rates
premium.customsTip3: Listed clearance items are duty-free up to $200
premium.customsTip4: Cosmetics and supplements may have additional quantity restrictions
premium.customsRateNote: ‚Äª Actual customs rates may vary depending on HS code.
premium.tipEtiquette1: USA/Canada: Restaurant 15-20%, Bar $1/drink, Taxi 15%, Hotel staff $1-2/bag
premium.tipEtiquette2: Europe: Service charge typically included, leave small change
premium.tipEtiquette3: Japan: Tipping not necessary, may be considered rude
premium.tipEtiquette4: Southeast Asia: Tourist areas 5-10%, local restaurants not required
premium.tipPaymentText: For card payments, write the tip amount directly on the receipt. For cash, leave it on the table when you leave.
